verses.kjv: And Joshua gathered all the tribes of Israel to Shechem, and called for the elders of Israel, and for their heads, and for their judges, and for their officers; and they presented themselves before God.
verses.web: Joshua gathered all the tribes of Israel to Shechem, and called for the elders of Israel, for their heads, for their judges, and for their officers; and they presented themselves before God.
verses.ct: Joshua gathered all the tribes of Israel at Shechem. He summoned the elders, the tribal leaders, the judges, and the officials, and they all presented themselves before God.

verses.kjv: And Joshua said unto all the people, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, Your fathers dwelt on the other side of the flood in old time, even Terah, the father of Abraham, and the father of Nachor: and they served other gods.
verses.web: Joshua said to all the people, “LORD, the God of Israel, says, ‘Your fathers lived of old time beyond the River, even Terah, the father of Abraham, and the father of Nahor. They served other gods.
verses.ct: Joshua addressed the entire assembly: "This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: 'Long ago, your ancestors — including Terah, the father of Abraham and Nahor — lived beyond the Euphrates River, and they worshiped other gods.

verses.kjv: And I took your father Abraham from the other side of the flood, and led him throughout all the land of Canaan, and multiplied his seed, and gave him Isaac.
verses.web: I took your father Abraham from beyond the River, and led him throughout all the land of Canaan, and multiplied his offspring, and gave him Isaac.
verses.ct: But I took your father Abraham from beyond the river and led him through the entire land of Canaan. I gave him many descendants and gave him his son Isaac.

verses.kjv: And I gave unto Isaac Jacob and Esau: and I gave unto Esau mount Seir, to possess it; but Jacob and his children went down into Egypt.
verses.web: I gave to Isaac Jacob and Esau: and I gave to Esau Mount Seir, to possess it. Jacob and his children went down into Egypt.
verses.ct: To Isaac I gave Jacob and Esau. I gave Esau the hill country of Seir as his own, but Jacob and his children went down to Egypt.

verses.kjv: I sent Moses also and Aaron, and I plagued Egypt, according to that which I did among them: and afterward I brought you out.
verses.web: “ ‘I sent Moses and Aaron, and I plagued Egypt, according to that which I did among them: and afterward I brought you out.
verses.ct: Then I sent Moses and Aaron, and I struck Egypt with plagues — just as you've heard. Afterward, I brought you out.

verses.kjv: And I brought your fathers out of Egypt: and ye came unto the sea; and the Egyptians pursued after your fathers with chariots and horsemen unto the Red sea.
verses.web: I brought your fathers out of Egypt: and you came to the sea. The Egyptians pursued your fathers with chariots and with horsemen to the Red Sea.
verses.ct: I brought your ancestors out of Egypt, and you came to the sea. The Egyptians chased after your ancestors with chariots and horsemen all the way to the Red Sea.

verses.kjv: And when they cried unto the LORD, he put darkness between you and the Egyptians, and brought the sea upon them, and covered them; and your eyes have seen what I have done in Egypt: and ye dwelt in the wilderness a long season.
verses.web: When they cried out to LORD, he put darkness between you and the Egyptians, and brought the sea on them, and covered them; and your eyes saw what I did in Egypt. You lived in the wilderness many days.
verses.ct: Your ancestors cried out to the LORD, and he put darkness between you and the Egyptians. Then he brought the sea crashing down on them and drowned them. You saw with your own eyes what I did in Egypt. After that, you lived in the wilderness for a long time.

verses.kjv: And I brought you into the land of the Amorites, which dwelt on the other side Jordan; and they fought with you: and I gave them into your hand, that ye might possess their land; and I destroyed them from before you.
verses.web: “ ‘I brought you into the land of the Amorites, that lived beyond the Jordan. They fought with you, and I gave them into your hand. You possessed their land, and I destroyed them from before you.
verses.ct: I brought you into the land of the Amorites, who lived east of the Jordan. They fought against you, but I handed them over to you. You took their land, and I wiped them out ahead of you.

verses.kjv: Then Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab, arose and warred against Israel, and sent and called Balaam the son of Beor to curse you:
verses.web: Then Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab, arose and fought against Israel. He sent and called Balaam the son of Beor to curse you,
verses.ct: Then Balak son of Zippor, the king of Moab, rose up and made war against Israel. He sent for Balaam son of Beor to put a curse on you.

verses.kjv: But I would not hearken unto Balaam; therefore he blessed you still: so I delivered you out of his hand.
verses.web: but I would not listen to Balaam; therefore he blessed you still. So I delivered you out of his hand.
verses.ct: But I refused to listen to Balaam, so instead he blessed you again and again. That is how I rescued you from Balak's schemes.

verses.kjv: And ye went over Jordan, and came unto Jericho: and the men of Jericho fought against you, the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Girgashites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites; and I delivered them into your hand.
verses.web: “ ‘You went over the Jordan, and came to Jericho. The men of Jericho fought against you, the Amorite, the Perizzite, the Canaanite, the Hittite, the Girgashite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite; and I delivered them into your hand.
verses.ct: You crossed the Jordan and came to Jericho. The people of Jericho fought against you, along with the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Girgashites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites — but I handed them all over to you.

verses.kjv: And I sent the hornet before you, which drave them out from before you, even the two kings of the Amorites; but not with thy sword, nor with thy bow.
verses.web: I sent the hornet before you, which drove them out from before you, even the two kings of the Amorites; not with your sword, nor with your bow.
verses.ct: I sent the hornet ahead of you, and it drove them out — including the 2 Amorite kings. It wasn't your sword or your bow that did it.

verses.kjv: And I have given you a land for which ye did not labour, and cities which ye built not, and ye dwell in them; of the vineyards and oliveyards which ye planted not do ye eat.
verses.web: I gave you a land on which you had not labored, and cities which you didn’t build, and you live in them. You eat of vineyards and olive groves which you didn’t plant.’
verses.ct: I gave you land you never worked, cities you never built — and now you live in them. You eat from vineyards and olive groves you never planted.'"

verses.kjv: Now therefore fear the LORD, and serve him in sincerity and in truth: and put away the gods which your fathers served on the other side of the flood, and in Egypt; and serve ye the LORD.
verses.web: “Now therefore fear LORD, and serve him in sincerity and in truth. Put away the gods which your fathers served beyond the River, in Egypt; and serve LORD.
verses.ct: "So now, fear the LORD and serve him with complete honesty and faithfulness. Get rid of the gods your ancestors worshiped beyond the Euphrates and in Egypt, and serve the LORD.

verses.kjv: And if it seem evil unto you to serve the LORD, choose you this day whom ye will serve; whether the gods which your fathers served that were on the other side of the flood, or the gods of the Amorites, in whose land ye dwell: but as for me and my house, we will serve the LORD.
verses.web: If it seems evil to you to serve LORD, choose today whom you will serve; whether the gods which your fathers served that were beyond the River, or the gods of the Amorites, in whose land you dwell; but as for me and my house, we will serve LORD.”
verses.ct: But if serving the LORD seems like a bad idea to you, then choose today who you will serve — whether the gods your ancestors worshiped beyond the river, or the gods of the Amorites in whose land you now live. But as for me and my household, we will serve the LORD."

verses.kjv: And the people answered and said, God forbid that we should forsake the LORD, to serve other gods;
verses.web: The people answered, “Far be it from us that we should forsake LORD, to serve other gods;
verses.ct: The people answered, "We would never abandon the LORD to serve other gods!

verses.kjv: For the LORD our God, he it is that brought us up and our fathers out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage, and which did those great signs in our sight, and preserved us in all the way wherein we went, and among all the people through whom we passed:
verses.web: for it is LORD our God who brought us and our fathers up out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage, and who did those great signs in our sight, and preserved us in all the way in which we went, and among all the peoples through the middle of whom we passed.
verses.ct: The LORD our God is the one who brought us and our ancestors up out of Egypt, out of slavery. He performed those incredible signs right before our eyes. He protected us the entire journey and through every nation we passed through.

verses.kjv: And the LORD drave out from before us all the people, even the Amorites which dwelt in the land: therefore will we also serve the LORD; for he is our God.
verses.web: LORD drove out from before us all the peoples, even the Amorites who lived in the land. Therefore we also will serve LORD; for he is our God.”
verses.ct: The LORD drove out all the peoples ahead of us, including the Amorites who lived in this land. So yes — we too will serve the LORD, because he is our God."

verses.kjv: And Joshua said unto the people, Ye cannot serve the LORD: for he is an holy God; he is a jealous God; he will not forgive your transgressions nor your sins.
verses.web: Joshua said to the people, “You can’t serve LORD, for he is a holy God. He is a jealous God. He will not forgive your disobedience nor your sins.
verses.ct: Joshua said to the people, "You won't be able to serve the LORD, because he is a holy God. He is a jealous God. He will not forgive your rebellion or your sins.

verses.kjv: If ye forsake the LORD, and serve strange gods, then he will turn and do you hurt, and consume you, after that he hath done you good.
verses.web: If you forsake LORD, and serve foreign gods, then he will turn and do you evil, and consume you, after he has done you good.”
verses.ct: If you abandon the LORD and serve foreign gods, he will turn against you. He will bring disaster on you and destroy you — even after all the good he has done for you."

verses.kjv: And the people said unto Joshua, Nay; but we will serve the LORD.
verses.web: The people said to Joshua, “No, but we will serve LORD.”
verses.ct: But the people said to Joshua, "No! We will serve the LORD."

verses.kjv: And Joshua said unto the people, Ye are witnesses against yourselves that ye have chosen you the LORD, to serve him. And they said, We are witnesses.
verses.web: Joshua said to the people, “You are witnesses against yourselves that you have chosen LORD yourselves, to serve him.” They said, “We are witnesses.”
verses.ct: Joshua said to the people, "You are witnesses against yourselves — you have chosen the LORD and committed to serve him." They replied, "We are witnesses."

verses.kjv: Now therefore put away, said he, the strange gods which are among you, and incline your heart unto the LORD God of Israel.
verses.web: “Now therefore put away the foreign gods which are among you, and incline your heart to LORD, the God of Israel.”
verses.ct: "Then get rid of the foreign gods that are among you," he said, "and turn your hearts fully to the LORD, the God of Israel."

verses.kjv: And the people said unto Joshua, The LORD our God will we serve, and his voice will we obey.
verses.web: The people said to Joshua, “We will serve LORD our God, and we will listen to his voice.”
verses.ct: The people said to Joshua, "We will serve the LORD our God and obey his voice."

verses.kjv: So Joshua made a covenant with the people that day, and set them a statute and an ordinance in Shechem.
verses.web: So Joshua made a covenant with the people that day, and made for them a statute and an ordinance in Shechem.
verses.ct: That day Joshua made a covenant with the people and established laws and regulations for them at Shechem.

verses.kjv: And Joshua wrote these words in the book of the law of God, and took a great stone, and set it up there under an oak, that was by the sanctuary of the LORD.
verses.web: Joshua wrote these words in the book of the law of God; and he took a great stone, and set it up there under the oak that was by the sanctuary of LORD.
verses.ct: Joshua recorded all of this in the book of the law of God. Then he took a large stone and set it up beneath the oak tree near the sanctuary of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And Joshua said unto all the people, Behold, this stone shall be a witness unto us; for it hath heard all the words of the LORD which he spake unto us: it shall be therefore a witness unto you, lest ye deny your God.
verses.web: Joshua said to all the people, “Behold, this stone shall be a witness against us, for it has heard all LORD’s words which he spoke to us. It shall be therefore a witness against you, lest you deny your God.”
verses.ct: Joshua told all the people, "Look at this stone — it will stand as a witness against us, because it has heard every word the LORD spoke to us. It will be a witness against you if you ever turn your backs on your God."

verses.kjv: So Joshua let the people depart, every man unto his inheritance.
verses.web: So Joshua sent the people away, each to his own inheritance.
verses.ct: Then Joshua sent the people away, each to their own inherited land.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass after these things, that Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of the LORD, died, being an hundred and ten years old.
verses.web: After these things, Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of LORD, died, being one hundred ten years old.
verses.ct: Sometime after these events, Joshua son of Nun, the servant of the LORD, died at the age of 110.

verses.kjv: And they buried him in the border of his inheritance in Timnathserah, which is in mount Ephraim, on the north side of the hill of Gaash.
verses.web: They buried him in the border of his inheritance in Timnathserah, which is in the hill country of Ephraim, on the north of the mountain of Gaash.
verses.ct: They buried him within the boundaries of his own land at Timnathserah, in the hill country of Ephraim, north of Mount Gaash.

verses.kjv: And Israel served the LORD all the days of Joshua, and all the days of the elders that overlived Joshua, and which had known all the works of the LORD, that he had done for Israel.
verses.web: Israel served LORD all the days of Joshua, and all the days of the elders who outlived Joshua, and had known all the work of LORD, that he had worked for Israel.
verses.ct: Israel served the LORD throughout Joshua's lifetime and throughout the lifetimes of the elders who outlived Joshua — those who had personally witnessed everything the LORD had done for Israel.

verses.kjv: And the bones of Joseph, which the children of Israel brought up out of Egypt, buried they in Shechem, in a parcel of ground which Jacob bought of the sons of Hamor the father of Shechem for an hundred pieces of silver: and it became the inheritance of the children of Joseph.
verses.web: They buried the bones of Joseph, which the children of Israel brought up out of Egypt, in Shechem, in the parcel of ground which Jacob bought from the sons of Hamor the father of Shechem for a hundred pieces of silver. They became the inheritance of the children of Joseph.
verses.ct: The bones of Joseph, which the Israelites had carried up from Egypt, were buried at Shechem in the plot of land that Jacob had purchased from the sons of Hamor, the father of Shechem, for 100 pieces of silver. This land became part of the inheritance of Joseph's descendants.

verses.kjv: And Eleazar the son of Aaron died; and they buried him in a hill that pertained to Phinehas his son, which was given him in mount Ephraim.
verses.web: Eleazar the son of Aaron died. They buried him in the hill of Phinehas his son, which was given him in the hill country of Ephraim.
verses.ct: Eleazar son of Aaron also died. They buried him at Gibeah, the town that had been given to his son Phinehas in the hill country of Ephraim.
